text: Decent BBQ and a real value.  I was shocked when I saw the price for beer - much less than I expected in Vegas.  Had the ribs and chicken - it was "OK" lots of sticky bbq sauce.   The corn on the cob was way over done and flavorless.  The bread was not worth the trouble.  Good service and quick.

First things, first: Use the parking structure behind the casino/restaurant.  It's free, more convenient, and keeps your car cooler.  With that out of the way...

If you love ribs, and don't mind getting your fingers a bit messy, this is an excellent place to eat for a very reasonable price.  You'll be tempted to go to the main dining room, and there's nothing wrong with that place, but you'll certainly want to give the rib-joint consideration.  Splurge and go for the full-rack.  The half-rack is fine for a limited appetite, but if you're hungry just go for the full-rack.

The ribs are loaded with sauce, and the meat just falls off of the bone with little effort, which is exactly what you're looking for in a good rack of ribs.  You'll get a small (very, very small) portion of baked beans and creamy coleslaw, along with two pieces of bread, but your attention will be on the ribs, so that's not too much of a problem.

I see a review to the right as I'm typing, and another user complained about some tranny prostitutes, but I didn't see any the few times I've been to this location.  As to the restaurant being "kid friendly", I'm not sure what that means, but Las Vegas is for adults, and there are clearly designated areas where children aren't allowed, i.e., the casino portion of the establishment.  There are plenty of places for the kids to sit in the restaurant portions of the establishment, but you shouldn't expect a Circus Circus experience here.

From Los Angeles and BBQ at Ellis Island is high on my list of places to eat.  Finger licking good.  Great portions Great prices.  Gotta try it if you have never been.  To add they brew their own beer. Amber is my fav.

I was in Vegas on a business trip. We actually came to this casino for the $10 steak special, but the next evening, came back for the BBQ. A 1/2 rack for only $12.00. 

I've had lots of BBQ - in Nashville, various places in the South, smoke houses, etc. This place has to be close to, if not THE BEST BBQ I'VE EVER HAD!  So tender & tasty! I will be back EVERY trip to Vegas from now on.

We had a party of 8. The service was average but the food was excellent for the price. They have done quite a bit of renovations since the last time we were here. Highly recommended for good portions at reasonable prices.

5 stars!!! The service (Jeanne) was unbelievable and she very much catered to my boyfriend who asks a million questions and very hard to please. There steak prices are ridiculously cheap and he ordered two and loved them despite they weren't a rib eye. I am a huge fan of fish and chips and very critical, it was 9.99 and unbelievable! Free parking and Karaoke!!! Great place, this is now going to be our favorite spot in Vegas!!! Love it!
Yummy BBQ, pleasant staff, and also a casino. Loads of fun!
We paid a cab just to come here and eat and no one told us that it was 21 and over. So they didn't let us in with our kids. They didn't even let us order to go! I'm extremely disappointed!!

I read all the yelp reviews about this place, so I had to try it out. It didn't disappoint we had the half chicken and half slab of ribs. The chicken ripped apart, the ribs were very tender, and the coleslaw was good. We will be coming back for sure.

É um churrasco estilo americano. Só servem frango e Costela de porco e sempre com o molho Barbecue. Não tem opção de carne sem o molho.  Eu que estava esperando um churrasco, padrão Brasil, me decepcionei. O preço é bom.

Took my 13yo kid and wife there today for Father's Day. Waiting for table and asked to leave by security due to being a 21 or older establishment. He told us kids take longer to feed than adults!  LOL! My 13yo eats more than I do and way faster.  Plus casino loaded with transgender prostitutes. 

Found Texas BBQ on St Rose Pkwy by the hospital that has better ribs anyways. Expect a lot more bad reviews from families. Words out, plus security was an a##hole!  #notkidfriendly
Great BBQ!!! Limited menu but everything is done right.  Good beer selection and a great place to.eat in Vegas at a reasonable price. We will definitely be back!
Recommended by our Uber driver and he was right. Damn good food for a damn good price. We did the half chicken, half ribs and the flavor was delish!

This is my favorite place to go to in Vegas! Good food and a great price! The breakfast is amazing and the environment is relaxing. I like to gamble before I eat and have a couple drinks. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place for anyone coming to Vegas

The ribs were fantastic! Chicken was good as well. Parts of it were a bit dry though. The sides are what makes me give the place 4 stars. The corn tasted like frozen corn on the cob...the beans weren't good and I like baked beans...the bread was awful...coleslaw was decent. Overall this was a good meal at a great price.  Their beer is pretty good as well..and cheap!

The food was OK, especially for the price. However, the big, dark-haired guy who was the 'greeter' at the entrance to the BBQ area was one of the ruder people I have ever encountered in 'customer service.' He was more of a grunter and sign-hitter than an explainer to us very confused diners (the guidelines for entrance to the BBQ area were not clear). We spoke with his manager about what happened, she said she would speak with him. After he came out of the kitchen he shot our table a nasty look! I was happy we already had our food, I would not have trusted him to bring our orders untainted...
Great place to eat. Chicken is moist and ribs are good too. And you can't beat the price. Wonderful restaurant off the strip, you won't be disappointed.

So I tried this place out for the first time tonight. I'm a big fan of the cafe so that's usually where I go when I'm at Ellis Island. But tonight I went with the BF and some of his friends and wow I'm glad we tried somewhere new. I'm kinda picky with my BBQ but this place was on point. The chicken was juicy, the ribs were tender and fall off the bone. The root beer was sooo good. I definitely know where I'm going next time I'm in the mood for some BBQ.

Senior bartender lady with blonde hair at the main bar needs to throw in the towel. This woman is extremely slow, and has no sense of how to scan a bar. The night i went the place was slow and it's like she was having a senior moment @ work, which isn't cool when tourist are out trying to have a good time. Nothing wrong with her continuing to work, but they need to remove her from the main bar if she can't keep up with the pace. I tipped her even though it took her 5 minutes to acknowledge me. The younger Hispanic guy is fast and friendly. He really doesn't need her at the bar with him.

So excited to try this place for the 1st time.. got to use yelp to reserve but when we got to the restaurant the hostess said we just missed it so it would be an hour wait. Really! Missed it by 5 minutes because we checked in at the pub.. bad customer service.. too bad we didn't get to try this place out

Wonderful ribs. I am a local and had never stumbled into this place because well, it's off the strip. Only 5 diff items to choose from but that's fine. Delicious... the bread is good, the corn I added a little salt to and it was tasty, the beans aren't my cup of tea but I dislike beans to start with. The ribs- star of the plate. I am from down south and ribs have to be tender and moist. This place knocked it out of the park. I will make the little drive for These again,

The wings are really excellent. And reasonable price. Large, full rack for $19. You also get corn (overcooked and bland), baked beans (good), slaw (generic) and garlic bread (not very garlicky and not homemade... basically just a hot dog bun).

Ellis Island is a dive but had a blast. $1 drafts, too, of their own brew.

Food was good. Service was awful. Instead of letting us sit with the rest of our group we had to sit at a table too far to make conversation because the table next to the rest of the group wasn't in the server's section. Then she didn't take our order for about twenty minutes. We asked a second time if we could move next to the rest our group and she said no and seemed really bothered by having to even entertain the question. Then we just got up and moved to the still empty table next to the rest of the group, as their food was arriving. We finally got our food and the remainder of the group joined and they wouldn't split their checks "because it was easier" on the servers. Aww poor things. The people who work here have absolutely no concept of service. Never coming back here again.

This is the only place that I will eat ribs in public.  The ribs are cooked to perfection and the serving size is large.  The meal in it's entirety will fulfill your craving for BBQ.  The price is very affordable and the service is great.  Simplicity is some times the finest.
Was good. A real dive, but good. The sides were not tasty at all but the chicken was enjoyable. I think you need to come for the BBQ baby backs, but I don't eat pork so had the chicken.

This is not the first time I've been here nor would it be my last. I have been few more than a handful of times. It used to be in the front of the casino by the brewery but now it has its own restaurant. The restaurant opens daily at 4pm, YES 4 in the afternoon ! and closes at 10 (Sun - Thurs) and 11pm (Fri - Sat). Very limited parking in front but they have a garage in the back. 

NOTE: you HAVE to be 21 and over to dine at this restaurant. IDs are required if they are suspicious of age. had one case where some friends had to return home 20 minutes away to grab IDs and come back. 

FYI - DISCOUNT FOR PLAYERS CLUB CARD. FREE TO OBTAIN. WORTH THE $2 DIFF PER ITEM ! ACQUITE COUPON FROM PLAYERS CLUB KIOSK - APPLICABLE FOR ENTIRE TABLE ! Also, during your wait, you can attempt your luck at the nearest machine. For new applicants, you have a chance of free play $5 - $500 after you put in $5 of your own money. 

Something new as of this recent visit. You are able to go on waitlist by yelp app and you have a tracking of waitlist position by NoWait app. Didn't know about the waitlist by yelp app but we were told our wait was 45-60 minutes being in 13th place. We were sat down in maybe less than 30 minutes. We've always had a wait every time I had came here, just depends if its a short or longer wait. The turnover rate is fairly quick so the waits usually not too bad. 

Decently sized restaurant with a lot of tables. Give or take 3-4 servers attending to the entire restaurant. 

The menu is VERY simple of only 4 items.

Full Rack Baby Back Ribs $16.99 ($14.99 with players club card)
Half Rack & Half BBQ Chicken $14.99 ($12.99 with players club card)
Half Rack Baby Back Ribs $12.99 ($10.99 with players club card)
Half BBQ Chicken $11.99 ($9.99 with players club card)

All entrees come with their own root beer barbeque baked beans, corn on the cob, cole slaw, and garlic bread

SIDE NOTE - $5 SPLIT PLATE charge and NO SPLIT CHECKS (well this recent visit, they allowed 2 credit cards. YMMV?)

We decided to ask about the beers as they are locally brewed in house. $2.50 for 20oz ! HOLY CRAP ! CHEAP ! LOL 

I had ordered a full rack of ribs, one friend (whos never came here before) got half rack and half chicken, and another friend who I almost always come with, had gotten only a half rack of ribs. Took maybe 5-10 minutes for the waiter to tend to our table but things went decently after that. Beers and waters came like 10 minutes later. Food came shortly after too. 

Lots of food for the money. For my order, 11 rib rack with 2 pieces of corn, a cup of cole slaw, a cup of baked beans, and 2 "sticks" of garlic bread. For the most part, it is the same as its always been except the garlic bread went from something maybe cut from a loaf of bread to actual bread sticks. 

Ribs are always so good. Fall off the bone, super tender. Love their barbeque sauce. I had been craving this for at least 1.5 years (since my trip to Orlando in Nov 2015) where I had ribs. Baked beans are cooked with root beer apparently and with bacon. Never been a fan of cole slaw but it had some bell peppers in it which made it a little weird normal than normal. 

I never had problems in the past finishing a full rack of ribs and everything but this time, I was only able to eat half of the rack. Worst of all, we got a HUGE food coma afterwards and knocked out early. 

Great deal overall for good ribs. Can't beat it anywhere in town. If only it was more convenient to get to but maybe that would be a bad thing, if you know what I mean... XD

I go to LV twice a year for business and we stay pretty close to EI.  It is one block off the strip just down from Ballys and Flamingos so a pretty good location.  We stay at the Tuscany (check it out) and it is one block from EL and two blocks from Ballys.  EL is a casino with restaurants and a hotel right next door (Days Inn I think).   It is also walking distance from EI to the High Roller (check it out) and a relatively new shopping and restaurant area next to the High Roller and when there, you don't even know you are in LV.... No slot machines LOL. 

EI is truly a local favorite and our business group always make it a point to spend time there.  I always go one night and have the steak dinner which I think is $8.99.  That comes with a nice thick steak (Tip: don't get it medium well unless you really want it well done).  It comes with soup or salad, veggies and potatoes so is a pretty good deal.  This time I ordered the BBQ and it was pretty good, juicy and flavorful.  It is not as good as Chattanooga BBQ but not bad.  They do give you so much that you can hardly finish it. 

Now the good part.  They are also a microbrewery and make their own beer (I guess that is why it is called a microbrewery).  Beer is $2.25 a pint and when a game is on, beers are only a DOLLAR (+++!).  I always get the Amber which is very good.  They also have karaoke in the bar area (I think every night) and it is fun but if you want to participate, you sometimes have to wait and hour to show off. 

I have to give it a 4++ and I suggest you try it out.. it is not fancy but truly a local icon.

Great Place!  Awesome deals on delicious tacos $5 2 tacos and a shot Taco Tuesdays, $5 wings and shot Wednesdays! $9.99 steak dinners too. Good but inexpensive, perfect for families and after you've gambled a little too much than you realized  They also have karaokes and you can even rent it out to families/groups- i'd like to try that next time. Bar tender/older man Hispanic was a little sour on the personality, nice he replaced our shots after we accidentally knocked the table down though. 
     So glad we found this place and for sure will be coming back! We enjoyed our dinning and entertainment. Only thing was about the hotel- the door wouldn't open/jammed a lot every time we went in. But place was clean inside and had HBO- as for the positive.. good to stay if you're not planning to be in the room much/ just to sleep. Thanks for the experience Ellis island Cafe/Tacos/Brewery!

This used to be my favorite place for prime rib in all of Las Vegas and I recommended it to every one my friends visiting from out of town. Sadly it no longer measures up. Oh the prime rib is still awesome; however, the baked potato was a refugee from a crematorium, beverage was no longer included, and the service was grudging.  What a shame to see such a wonderful place for locals to eat has now sunk into the dregs of commercialism determined to squeeze every last penny out of a customer.

I absolutely love this place! Its so fun and exciting. Me and my bf came twice since we have been coming to Vegas and ever since we heard about this place we have came back.. They have cheap beer and inexpensive food that's really good! I love the environment. We just went last weekend on Saturday April 30th during the day we went on a bad weekend cause of the rain and all but other then that we all had a good time. We went on with a large group of 9 with family and everyone had a good time. They have 2.00 draft beers. I'm not sure what kinda oz's they have but they have those big glasses... The food is delicious for a small cafe and casino. That's the only downside I'd have to give is that sometimes there is a long wait for the cafe and small casino. But environment is awesome. They also have their own brewery! Most of us tried there own brewed root beer soda it was THE BEST ROOT beer I've ever tried. Its a must try. As well as the food I had the ham and eggs for a late brunch it was the bomb. Lol I'm not much of a ham person I wanted breakfast... And they have certain item combinations for breakfast plates and the ham and eggs with potatoes is on point. One of my favorites. I will definitely will be coming back here. This is our go to spot to hangout and have a few drinks. :) good price and good food...
This is a "hole in the wall" place but a great bbq restaurant. It's small  and very casual. Great service

What a hidden gem right off the strip! I was recommended by a friend that this place was a must go for BBQ if you're on The Strip. For $16 you get a huge full rack of ribs with amazing barbecue sauce. Also comes with a side of fries, corn and toast. Pair that rack of ribs with a pint of beer, which they have a great selection on draft and brew some themselves. There was also no wait for a table. Definitely worth going to if you're nearby. Hopefully remains the hidden gem that it is today.

Good BBQ meats, but the side dishes were very disappointing. A sweet sauce covers the very generous portions of BBQ. The corn on the cob was the frozen variety, baked beans watery, garlic bread and coleslaw were OK.  Would rather pay a few dollars more for better quality sides.  Maybe add fries to the menu as an option.
This is probably one of the best BBQ places I've been to in a long time. I think the food taste 100% great! If you are looking for a quick bite to eat, check out this place!

Was given a 45 minute wait that ended up being 20 minutes. 10 minutes later we get our food. Baby back ribs were superb and please get the Oktoberfest brew. You have to come here I was extremely pleased. Best food and value.

I was a little skeptical to try this place at first because it was off the Strip and in an isolated area. However, I'm glad I decided to give this place a try. Quick note: if you plan to eat here with people under 21, you have to be 21+ to enter the restaurant. 

I ordered the half rack of ribs, which came with 2 slices of garlic bread, half a corn of cob, coleslaw, and baked beans. The plates are GIANT. The dish could easily be shared by 2 people. The ribs were seasoned perfectly. They were tender and melted in my mouth. The meal was super satisfying and kept me full for the whole night.
Delicious food highly recommend the bbq ribs are a must try and for a reasonable price don't hesitate to try out this bbq place

One of my favorite bbq spots when in Vegas!! For $12.99 (with players card) you can get 1/2 chicken, 1/2 rack of super yummy ribs that also comes with 1/2 corn on cob, coleslaw, baked bbq beans and bread. Where else can you get a deal like that!! Plus its actually absolutely delicious!! The chicken breast are a bit on dry side and the bread a bit bland. My only complaints if any. The flavors of both the chicken and ribs are just delicious and full of yummy flavors. And the bbq sauce at the table is very tangy and yummy too! Did i get y'all mouth watering yet?

Oh and don't forget the ice cold root beer. I think their root beer and made fresh themselves and on tap. It sooo yummy!! One of the best root beers I've had!

Ambiance is dimmed lighting and there is a glass on one wall where you can see the screens of the bar on other side and watch the games, fights etc. Double score!

Service was great. Still giving it 5 stars with the little bit of flaws because for the price you pay for all that food and when majority and main dish is perfectly seasoned, i wont even complain.

Geez, talking about it makes me want to go back and get some! Too bad i have to wait until my next trip to Vegas.

The BBQ here is to die for. We are Las Vegas locals an when we get visitors we always take them here. 

Must be 21 or over. 

U get your choice of 1/2 chicken, 1/2 slab of ribs or a combo plate with sides. If u get casino card chicken dinner is only $8 and crazy good. 

There was 3 of us tonight 2 had ribs and I had chicken dinners. 2 beers and 1 beverage. With tip out bill was $53. 

Casino is being renovated so doesn't smell anymore like stale cigarettes yay. Great surprise.
We read the reviews on yelp. My girlfriend was sceptical about eating here. I convinced her that it had great reviews. Long story short. She can't stop talking about how good the ribs were.
The food in here is ridiculous but in a good way. We got ribs and chicken whichbcsme with corn on the cob, bbq beans and coleslaw. It was all great.

Got the prime rib here on my last vegas trip in september.  Good service, ok atmosphere.. its a local casino/bar/casino.  Prices were surprisingly decent for the amount of food you get.

I personally like Lawrys more for prime rib.. but i can def see myself coming back.. next time, ribs!
Amazing! First time going there and I got the hangover burger and was very satisfied. For a great price definit recomend it.

Very disappointing! I was really looking forward to " Real bbq meat"!,,    The beef ribs obviously was boiled first to tenderize,,then , slapped some bbq sauce on top! And the.chicken was the same,  over cooked and also slapped some bbq sauce on top! The beans had a very weird sour taste   coleslaw was just ok ! I dont  think we will be return g to Ellis island bbq ..sorry ...very disappointed.. for the price,  it wasnt worth it!

I love the good here. The baby back ribs were sooo tender. The portions are huge and reasonably priced. It's well worth it to come off strip for the food. My boyfriend and i shared a combo and barely finished it. The wait was quite long. However,  you can sign in on YELP to put yourself in line. So I just put us down for a table as we were walking in trying to find the restaurant.

OMG ! This is the best barbecue in Las Vegas ! Just off the strip , reasonably priced and so much better than the other higher priced places on Vegas. Huge portions - turkey platters for the plate . Had the 1/2 chicken and half rib slab . You can't beat this value for the price ! Will definitely be a monthly ritual !

Sorry I don't give 1 stars unless warranted but this place was terrible. Meat dry, vegetable Meledy was frozen veggies, beans cold. Service - there was no service, no smiles, no welcome, menus shoved in table. I won't be coming back
Best deal ever! So much food for your buck! Never disappoints! Great service and free parking!
Awesome BBQ. Half rack baby backs were excellent with a large dark beer. Corn, slaw and beans topped off the whole dinner. Hope to stop by again next time I'm in Vegas, baby!!

So this is a hidden gem we heard about from a friend.  It's off strip and has great off menu special.

They do an 8oz steak, eggs, toast for $6.99.   You gotta ask for this deal specifically as not on menu.  The prime rib is also soo juicy and comes with fully loaded baked potatoes.  I like the horseradish sauce with it.  We heard that there was a special as well but our server said not this night.

The servers were prompt and food came out quickly.  We had a good time.  Not sure I'd return in future though bc theres so many other great options in Vegas.  This is more of a 3.5 star

Worse place ever to go kareoke! If you're  not a local, you won't sing at all and they don't even hide the fact that you are unimportant to their set or night all together.  Not good when you're  just looking for a fun place to sing while out of town. Not to mention the kj is pretty much wastey face the entire night so she can't keep track of much anyways. (Tabitha) Thumbs down sorry
This is the best place in Vegas to get chicken and waffles. Reasonably priced and the staff seems hard working

This is a fantastic gem and well worth taking an Uber from the strip!

First off, its cheap. Steak dinner for less than $10, half-rack of ribs for $12. You can't hardly get a hot dog for $10 on the strip. 

Second, and most importantly, it is fantastic food. Their root beer BBQ is like liquid crack and the ribs were falling off the bone tender. I can't recall ever having more tender or better tasting ribs. The sides were good (Baked beans, cole slaw, corn on the cob and garlic bread), but the ribs stole the show.

My wife got the half chicken and she said it was cooked perfectly.

Our server was Ricardo, and he did a fantastic job of being scarce when we didn't need him but appearing within seconds if we needed something. He did a great job of making sure we wanted for nothing. 

I ate dinner at Prime steakhouse in Bellagio a few days ago, and it would honestly be a toss up if ok asked me to pick one.....if you were paying. If I'm paying, me and my money are going to Ellis Island!

I tried the prime rib and it was delicious! The fact that it was so cheap made it even better! Service was good and got in and out quick. I try to come here each time I visit Vegas which is about 2-3 times a year

Been coming here since 2003 and I love this place. Its been through  a few remodeling  changes  over the years, but  their latest is perfect.  The room décor is simple, minimal   and very cozy. Hours are 4pm - 10pm and this place is always busy but the flow of clients in and out is fast.   But if  you do end up waiting you can't blame them  the BBQ is delicious and know that you wont be disappointed.  The menu is simple BBQ chicken or pork ribs and sides are Cole slaw, root beer beans, corn on the cob  and bread with butter. The meat pulls right off the bone on the ribs and meat is not dry and the BBQ sauce is really good.  The chicken although I did not eat it this time it is really good as well. This casino has its own brewery and beers are  $2, back in the day they were just a $1 definitely a steal then and now and the perfect drink to compliment  your BBQ.  The food portions are huge for the money and if you get the players club card there is an extra savings on your meal so do not pass that up.  The service has always been good and employees are  always pleasant.  The only downfall to this restaurant is that you need to be 21 years of age to eat here.  If you are in Las Vegas this is one of the many hidden gems we have here do not miss it !
OMG this is a place that I miss a lot. I recommend quite a few places in Vegas, but this is the one I always try to make a point to go to every time I visit Vegas.
Fantastic must try very good runs and chicken can't beat the  the price and the casino is awesome $5 tables everywhere. The staff is all great to so friendly and happy to see you win.

This is my second visit this trip. The prime rib is so good.  This is an old school casino a couple of blocks off the strip. The place is old and not flashy but the prices are normal not ridiculous like about everything on the strip.
The bbq ribs were great! Falling off the bone. The portion was large. I'm definitely coming back.
The food was delicious and the price was goodAnd the service was excellent We enjoyed the food we will be back again

Based on all the GREAT reviews we headed over to Ellis Island BBQ. 

Point one: you have to walk thru the Ellis Island casino lobby to get to the BBQ. The cigarette smoke was immediate and terrible. It, literally, stinks. It's unbearable. 

Point two: the restaurant is in the stinky casino lobby. This is important. 

Point three: the patrons are (nearly) all morbidly obese Caucasians. 

Point four: there's no bar.

Point five: nothing on the (limited) menu costs more than $15. 

Conclusion: Ellis Island BBQ is just a casino restaurant cleverly hidden inside a stinky, cigarette smoke filled casino.

Probably the best BBQ ribs I have ever had. I would never think this place can be this good but after hearing about it so many times I gave it a try and was just amazed. Hands down best ribs I have ever had!

Have you all heard the term, the steak was so tender I could cut it with a fork? Have anyone of you that reads tried or done this? I have tried this and I actually did it at Ellis Island, no joke I cut my steak with a fork. 

Try it at your favorite place and when it doesn't happen, try it at a place that strives to give you the best food in all of Las Vegas dollar for dollar. 

Gerald & Ginger

Woo hoo, finally a decent bbq place in the heart of town.
Had the rack of ribs, came with their version of garlic bread, cole slaw(which i don't eat), and baked beans and corn on the cob. Needless to say, i'm used to a slab because i like the cartilage bones and twice as much. All that ended up was a empty plate, so it must not have been good!!!
The ribs were fall off the bone soft, not overly seasoned or too much sauce but very good smoked flavour.
Another great find was, they brew their own root beer, since I don't really like that yellow swill everyone drinks, I opted for the root beer, not too sweet and not overly carbonated but a big "go to" if you are not a beer fanatic.
The empty plate shows what I think about the food.

If I could give this place 10 Stars I would, every time I have a guess, I always stop here on the first day or before I go back home. 
I am not a pork fan in the least, I do not like pork chops, can't stand Pork tenderloin, it's just not my thing.. But this place, this beautiful Mecca of barbecue, has me turned on my head every single time I enter the building.

The coleslaw and beans are good, I like the chicken but the ribs are where it is at. I had the half rack, he had the half and half... As always the food was impeccable, and the service... Let me tell you about the service.

We had a waiter that was absolutely and immeasurably phenomenal. My friend had asked for a couple of glasses of water at one time, he brought them out within just under 30 seconds. He was back there slinging plates with the cook, doing an amazing balancing act with drinks all while ensuring all his tables had everything they needed. This gentleman has mastered the art of anticipatory service, a very fine skill Only Honed by some of the best FOH members in the industry.

Seriously these are some of the best ribs I have ever had. The knock is the only have ribs and chicken on the menu and only cole slaw and baked beans as sides. As long as everyone is going for ribs (and beer) you can't go wrong. The service is friendly and quick too.

5 stars alll the way!
Here is my full review of Ellis Island and their fabulous everything. I grew up in Las Vegas, so I like old-fashioned Vegas casinos with old-fashioned service. I'm not one for the big Glitz and glamour of the strip, I like something small, a little bit more intimate. My friend told me about the root beer here and how it's the best in the world. When it comes to root beer, I will be the judge of that. She told me they brew their own root beer here and I absolutely had to try it along with their rack of ribs.

Upon entering, I felt as if I was taken back into the early nineties of Las Vegas, karaoke was going and there was a DJ back in the back right in front of the barbecue house. 

I went in to order my food which was the rack of ribs and the root beer. I was absolutely surprised at the reasonable cost of my meal considering how much food I was going to get. While waiting, I decided to head outside and listen to music. The DJ didn't mind my impromptu belly dancing, neither did any of the patrons because that's the type of place this is. You can be real, you could be yourself, you could be fun and you don't have to worry about security wondering if you're on drugs. I'm not on drugs, I'm high on life and about ready to sit down to a darn good plate of food. Who wouldn't be excited and want to dance over that? A boring person that's who!

I came back to a large plate of ribs which pretty much fell off the bone. I don't like it when their Saucy and the meat has no flavor, this was the exact opposite of that!

However, my review is not on the food - it's on the root beer. My friend was right, slap my face... she was right!

It was the best darn root beer I had ever had.
I brew my own root beer, so that's saying a lot. It took a little while for our food to come out, but I didn't mind I had some dancing to do. Even if the arrival of my food took longer, I would have gone into the karaoke bar and entertained myself. 

If I had a problem with the wait, I should not have gone on Friday night when it was busy. However, I'm not one of those picky people that complain about waiting too long, I'm one of those fun people who will go find something to do to keep myself occupied. All in all, I absolutely love this little gem of a casino as it reminds me of the old days in Vegas. Not a lot of people remember old Vegas, Ellis Island is a tribute to that.

REASONS TO VISIT ELLIS ISLAND CASINO BBQ:
1. Old Vegas feeling
2. Intimate Environment
3. Not over crowed
4. Live DJ on Fridays
5. Karaoke while you're waiting for your ribs
6. Great rack of ribs!!!!
7. Amazing prices
8. Best root beer in the world

Went there for the ribs and they didn't disappoint. They were falling off the bone tender and with a little more sauce added, that's on the table, the ribs were great. The beans (just ok), corn (over cooked), coleslaw (kinda bland) and garlic bread (over toasted and no garlic) not so much. The menu is extremely limited and the ambience is on par with that of a high school cafeteria. I would definitely go back for the ribs.

Omg, this place was AMAZING. The BBQ is off to the side we had to ask where it was they have another restraunt in there so don't end up in the wrong place. They serve only BBQ but I'm from Chicago and it's some of the Best bbq I've ever had. Hidden Gem, they should expand.  This could be a stand alone place.

Came here on a suggestion by my Uber driver and boy does he also deserve high praise in addition to the 5-stars I already gave him. 

This place is about half a mile away from the Linx, just a short walk or Uber ride. The location itself is nothing to write home about and the hotel itself appears pretty plain and simple. The casino is on the smaller size but has all your typical Las Vegas gambling entertainment needs. They advertised $2 off for becoming a member and gambling $5 so I did. Also won $35 on one the machines while waiting about 20mins to be seated. The place was tinny and a little dark but the smell was amazing. The menu was surprisingly small. Either a full rack of babyback ribs, half a rack and half a chicken or just a half rack and all plates came with house made coleslaw, root beer BBQ sauce beans, two long bread roll things, and two small corns. Incredibly filling and delicious and best of all, CHEAP!  Alcoholic drinks were $2.50. They have a decent selection of wines and their beers are house made in their brewery and pretty tasty. Spent half of what I spent for lunch (a hamburger) at Wallburgers.  Pretty crazy. 

Thank you Uber driver for recommending this place and you better believe next time I'm in Vegas I'm coming back!

My wife & are are huge fans of Ellis Island, the bar & the bar B Que too!!!  Amazing prices (get their players card) incredible baby back ribs & the central bar is a crazy place to meet locals & have some great drinks at prices a fraction of the strip locations.   We come here every trip & will continue to!!!!
Crowd! Yes! Waited for 39 minutes! For six ! Jerry Ross an Kathy, wife! Pam an Bill! Chicken An ribs a whole dinner! Looks great!
Very tasty ribs and beer! )) Good service and nice restaurant design! Large portions and a variety of side dishes! )))

Always a great food spot for very affordable prices. 
Go early or there might be a long wait.

If you want ribs, COME here. Though aside from chicken, ribs is all they do. Meat was tender and the sauce was sweet and sticky. The sides were not memorable, and the bbq beans really need some tweaking. However, I was too meat-drunk to really care about the bread and coleslaw. We walked from Ballys to eat here, and it was well worth it.

Ellis island bbq is the best I've had yet.  I love the flavor and you can't beat the price.. My wife and I are regulars full wrack of ribs with slot club membership 14.99 you get the full wrack of ribs bread corn on the cob Cole slaw and bbq beans

Very bad service, closes in 40 min and they refused to take our party of six. There excuse was it's too close to closing to take my party! Wow!! Ok turn away customers because they don't want to work and serve customers!

Went here twice because even my friend's leftover steak and eggs were amazing. I tried their spaghetti, but wouldn't recommend it. Their steak and eggs and potatoes are what you need to get.

The wait was long and annoying. They wouldn't even let us order to go unless we were staying at the hotel. Server was really nice.

If I'm back in Vegas I might actually come back and just order pickup.

Seriously a hidden gem in Vegas! Gourmet meal it is not, but it's pretty damn solid and the price point is great for the portions served! 

They only serve 4 options: full rib rack, half rack, half chicken, or half chicken and half rack. Ribs are fall off the bone amazing and the chicken is very tender and juicy. All orders are served with a lightly toasted garlic bread, a really deliciously addictive baked beans, half a corn on the cob and refreshing cole slaw.
Oh and at the bar right outside the restaurant they serve the most kick ass housemade rootbeer too! 


Plus the casino this place is connected to do give you a discount voucher when you open up a free players card PLUS give you $5 credit when you spend $5 at a slot machine. Win win in my book where do much is over priced and over hyped.

I loved everything about Ellis island - except for their baked beans! I was brought here by a friend that HAD to visit for the phenomenal bbq - and I am so glad she introduced me to this place!  Simple menu plus outstanding food & service.  Huge servings mean everyone leaves full! Make sure you bring your appetite when you come to eat at Ellis Island BBQ!
Very small menu (like literally 4 or 5 choices) but the BBQ was quite good. The small casino was also a good warmup.

You beautiful, beautiful little baby. I love you. I have always loved you. I was so sad when I had to move away from you. I used to love coming here and hoping that I could make it in time to still get some delicious BBQ. THIS IS A HIDDEN GEM. Very limited menu but hands down the second best BBQ I have ever had. Coming in second to BBQ in Tennessee that is. 

I love the ribs. They are so tender and fall off the bone. Every time I've had them there's the perfect amount of char to BBQ sauce. Which, their BBQ sauce, to die for. It comes with two pieces of corn on the cob, baked beans with their own rootbeer sauce, coleslaw and bread. If you have a player's card with them, you get a discount. 

It's fast and delicious. The service is always great. Everyone there is on top of it. BY THE WAY, it used to be located by the front next to metro pizza. It is now in the back left corner, with it's own quaint dimly lit restaurant. Thank you for staying consistent and being delicious. I will see you again next Vegas trip.

The ribs here are fantastic and worth the trek away from the strip. The cocktails were a nice surprise, too. The one with blue curaçao was delicious and highly recommended. Be prepared to eat a lot, though. While the menu is rather limited, the portions are huge and worth splitting between people if you're not too hungry.

Best BBQ in all of Las Vegas, however, I haven't tried Roadkill yet. The BBQ here is consistent in flavor and tenderness. There's not a whole lot of choices; the menu is simple...ribs or chicken or you can do half and half. Sides are cole slaw, beans, garlic bread and corn. Not the best garlic bread as sometimes it's over toasted but I don't come here for the garlic bread. They have great homemade root beer but just fyi, it's NOT free refills. This racked up the bill lol. Great service. Shout out to the one guy hustlin in the kitchen everytime we're there :)

Hands down the best BBQ Ribs I've every had, and you add in the price this can't be beat!  You also can get huge $2 draft beers along with a full meal for cheap with your players card and a coupon.  The meat comes completely off the bone and the BBQ sauce is great!  A small place and it can get busy, but if you want a great meal for cheap and great BBQ, YOU NEED TO GO TO ELLIS ISLAND!!!

We've been to Ellis BBQ every time we visit Las Vegas & they never disappoint us! Their ribs are always Great.  It's a great value.  I do wish they'd work on their sides, their beans & coleslaw could use a little work. They have the best root beer & they make it!

Dinner here tonight with the family. Ordered the full rack which came with garlic bread, corn on the cob, root beer baked beans, and cole slaw. The star of the dish was the ribs. Perfectly smoked and then flash grilled. Excellent!!  

The beans and garlic bread were my least favorite and too me lacked flavor. The corn on the cob and Cole slaw were tasty.

The service here was very good and the prices extremely reasonable.

I've been coming to the Ellis Island BBQ for over 10 years. Over these 10 years, it has turned into one of my favorite restaurants in all of Las Vegas. Like every other time, my family and I came into the BBQ today and ordered four racks of ribs. The first thing that stood up was the below-average service that our server gave us. He overlooked the drinks and proceeded to asking for our orders. As we finished ordering, in a rude and irritated manner, asked for the drinks. It was a busy day so I was able to comprehend his attitude but when I saw that he treated another customer behind us with much more diligence, I knew it was personal. When the food came, all of our four coleslaws were slimy. When we told the server, he didn't apologize and simply brought four fresh coleslaws. The service and even the food appear to be going downhill, it's truly unfortunate to see such a good place decline.

The baby back ribs are superb as they have always been.  But Ellis Island has hiked prices 30% recently. 

The main draw used to be the prime rib dinner which they sold for $14.00. The dinner included a twenty ounce beer or root beer. That was a good deal, and me and many friends used to dine there very often. . 

Recently their management no longer provides the free beer or root bear [$2.50) that used to be comped with the meal. and they raised the price of the rib dinner to $17.00.  

It is not worth to me or my friends to drive downtown for a $20.00 meal when I could have the same fare close to home at some of the other casinos for quite a bit less. 

As an aside, I will not visit any casino that charges for parking.

The Strip and the managements are TRYING TO KILL THE GOOSE THAT LAID THE GOLDEN EGG.
Grub...great bang for the buck if you want baby back ribs.  Be sure to have your players card coupon for $3 off... $14.99 for a whole rack :P
This is the real deal.  Great ribs and chicken and basically that it's entire menu.  What they lack in scope of menu they more than make up for with the best ribs and chicken Q in Vegas

NEVER AGAIN!
We had heard the BBQ here was pretty good. So my husband and I, along with several of our friends thought we would come check out the place. OMG, what a huge mistake we made choosing to have dinner at Ellis Island BBQ! The food here could only be discribed as mediocre at best. Sadly, the food was about as good as it got at this BBQ joint. Almost immediately after our party was  seated, we came to realize that Ellis Island BBQ was staffed by what can only be discribed as absolutely the worst, most pathetic group of individuals hired to run a restaurant in the city of Las Vegas. Our dining experience started with us being waited on by a waiter in a crappy mood & apparently having a really bad day. He was accompanied by a manager who looked absolutely miserable, and could have cared less about the issues we were having with his employee and the food we were served. His actions and body language spoke volumes... I don't know about anyone else, but when the so called manager rolls his eyes, crosses his arms, is steadily tapping his foot and then lets out a big old sigh after we finish speaking with him, I get the feeling that myself and the group I  was with were not valued as customers. Hopefully, someone, anyone who has any REAL authority over the employees of Ellis Island BBQ will see this review. I would suggest that they send in undercover or mystery diners so they can get an idea of what is going on in this restaurant. Personally, I would let the entire crew go, starting with the manager.  Then get a fresh, new staff with a fresh new attitude in there to treat your clientele as they expect and deserve to be treated.
Humongous portions.  Chicken and rib combo comes from on the cob, coleslaw, beans and garlic bread.
Being from Virginia I know good baby back ribs when I get them and these are top-of-the-line!

Off the strip but a total win if you're hungry and in he mood for some BBQ! We were both so with only 30 minutes left until they closed we rushed over to Ellis Island BBQ. Now normally you get bad food or service if it's close to closing but not here. Kim was a sweetheart, food was sooo good and prices make this spot a win!

This review will be short and sweet, just like this menu. There are only a handful of choices: full chicken, 1/2 chicken, full rack ribs, 1/2 rack ribs. This is a no-fuss, all eats type of joint and it was amazing. The decor and ambience is not the main attraction, but honestly once you have these fall-off-the-bone ribs you could care less where you are at because your eyes roll to the back of your head in ecstasy anyway! Perfectly done, perfectly seasoned. The classic corn and slaw sides are a nice compliment. This is comfort food at its best.

This place is tiny with no ambiance, basically just a room full of tables. The food: good enough, but you only have 4 options to choose from. My ribs were a little dry but still good with lots of flavor. For the price it's certainly a good deal.. We paid less than $40 for three people. 

However, the reason I give just 2 stars was our waiter- probably the worst I've had in a long while. Unsociable, apathetic, maybe said less than 20 words the whole time, not at all concerned with us or our needs, and just plain rude. If you want to get service from someone who hates their job, go here! This guy was the worst.
Steak plate is not on the menu but it's$9.99 with potatoes and veggies. Great food and service!!!

Best place ever!! You can't be the price here for a good steak and the BBQ dinner they have! Also great pizza and beer! For sure this place is a hidden gem in vegas.. The BBQ place you get your standard bbq ribs or bbq chicken. (Served with sides of corn, bread, coleslaw and baked beans) for i believe $15 bucks WITH your players card, $17.99 without it so make sure you sign up first then head for the BBQ place!  The restaurant is also good! We usually get the steak special. Metro pizza is VERY good and this place brew their own beers.. Awesome little spot to visit!!
Tables and dealertainers are aweome. THE KARAKOE bar is not worth your time!

Service was incredibly slow when I stopped by for a weekend lunch. My party and I watched multiple groups who got seated after us finish their meals before us. Our server acknowledged the slow service but did nothing to rectify the situation. 

Moreover, my group was suppose to get a discount because we were also staying at the Ellis Island hotel. However, she messed up while scanning my card and we ended up paying full price. 

All in all, it was a very frustrating meal.

If you like barbeque.  Its a great spot.  If you're just hungry its a great spot.  Its not the best ever.  Its just the price is decent for what ya get.  This is an older review but I did come here a lot.  I went with a friend and he waited for some time and the service is either great or terrible depending on your timing. They do not offer too many options so vegams and vegetarians its not for you.  As for meat lovers its a hit or a miss.  I didn't enjoy here any of the times I've went.  Its remodeled and a bit newer so it may fit your fancy.  BBQ here in Vegas isnt all that stellar.  You're better off trying the other hidden gems located in town.

A very simple restaurant with a very simple menu of bbq ribs or bbq chicken. (Served with sides of corn, bread, coleslaw and baked beans)
The restaurant is a 21+ only restaurant 
I had the ribs and it was tender and flavor was good. This place does get crowded during dinner time, so try to come slightly earlier. 

Tip: If you sign up for the Ellis Island players card, you'll get a little discount on the meal ;)

Wish they had fries

You get discounts on your meal if you sign up for a players card which is free. I liked the machine where you make a players card it was convenient. Came here to try the barbecue and it was delicious and plentiful and great price for all the food they give you. I got the chicken and rack combo. It came with cold slaw, beans, corn, and bread. Everything was good. You can probably share a combo with someone else it can feed two people unless you plan on having leftovers to take home. There's only four choices on their menu. It's simple and good. Highly recommend it.
The prompt service is greatly appreciated, and the food is always delicious!! The ribs are scrumptious!! The servings are huge, and the price is great!!

If you're staying at Ellis Island, print your casino card at any kiosk. There will be two coupons you can take advantage of including a $10 steak and  $3 off coupon at EI BBQ. Order their "sampler" plate which is a half rack of ribs and a half chicken, with coleslaw, a whole cob of grilled corn, and country roll. This is the best option if you don't know what your stomach wants. Ribs are PHENOMENAL and chicken is Not dry! Their coleslaw has the perfect marriage of crunchy and vinegar. Their brewed beers are delicious and cheap (less than $3)! Ask for Ricardo, his service is magnificent and friendly.
Super inexpensive, huge plate, AMAZING food!!! Get a players card and put your name in and enjoy!

Mouthwatering BBQ steps from the strip! The price is right, especially if you sign-up for a player's card and then play $5 in slots for a $2 coupon. At this point, I've been there twice in the last 1.5 years of living in Vegas. I've been to BBQ spots in San Diego and NY, and this either meets or tops them with the way the meat is cooked to that bbq sauce that hits my tongue! I can still taste it! I have only ordered the half chicken/half rack because it is a lot for leftovers for myself. The beans are unique in flavor as they have a little spice/seasoning to them. The bread is soft and a tiny bit crisp on the edges. This meal comes with a whole corn cut in half and cole slaw.

I've only been on a weekend and there is a little wait. The 2nd time I went with my boyfriend and we were an hour early, but put our names on the list at the cafe which where in return they gave us a paper with a number on it because the bbq place will call that number out once they open at 4pm (on Sunday). Luckily, we were #1.

You can order a beer at the bar while you wait. I love Ellis Island for their beer and prices. Football Sunday they have 5 wings and a shot deal, buy 1 pizza and get one free deal, and a few other deals. Don't let the low prices make you think the food isn't good because the food is delicious for being next to the strip!!! They won't empty your pockets, unless you're a gambler :)

PS. Their winter beer is amazing! Tastes like Christmas in your mouth with that cinnamon.

Best spot to eat in Ellis island. The meat is always very tender and juicy. The corn bread is sweet and fluffy. Service is always great. Our waitress check on us like 10 times while we ate. Great bbq spot.

I've eaten at this restaurant for nearly 20 years, I've never been so disappointed in my expectations after a hundred experiences at the Ellis Island. It's been 4 years since I've been in Vegas, my first stop was Ellis Island for their famous steak, not so famous anymore! Price has doubled and the quality of the cut of meat is near shoe leather, very sad, once was the best steak I've eaten anywhere in the US. I hope the owners read this, not too long ago I had the steak and a tall beer for $6.99, now the steak is $12.99 plus the price of the beer. I'd rather eat at Buffalo Wild Wings for what I paid tonight, very sad, another Vegas mainstay is gone!

We really enjoyed the bar b q restaurant.  Only pork ribs and chicken on the menu, 4 choices of quantity and combination which makes ordering easy. Prices very fair and quantity good.  Really tasty food, simple but prepared perfectly. Highlight meal on our short trip to vegas and we also went to a $30+ buffet.  Recommended and will of course return.

Googled this places hours, it's listed as closing at 11.....The only thing worse than their deplorable service was their asinine excuses for it. The only thing they were good at was keeping their heads shoved in their asses

The place has been here for years. Their specialty is a steak and eggs breakfast. I had a prime rib French dip which was mediocre. Good but nothing great. My wife had a very good Club sandwich that was up in the top 10% of Clubs that I've seen. The next table had fish and chips which is definitely what I'll have next time I go. I also would have the steak and eggs. This place has no ambiance, NONE. But, if you want a good meal, go here.
The ribs are great, the service is fast, and the prices are low.  However, they have an extremely limited menu (no salads, deserts, etc) and there often is a wait for a table.

I was told this was the best fish fry in town.
Hopefully they were having a bad night since it was busy for Lent but there fish was dropping with grease

I love Ellis Island!  This is my late night go to spot after working at the clubs, and with good reason.  If I'm looking for a low key stop with a relaxed bar environment with good food after a night at a packed club; this is the place.  The first thing that sold me on Ellis Island is when I found out that they comp 2 free drinks for industry employees (I think this starts after 1 am).  I was told that as soon as I walked in.  Great first impression!  

The food here is always good.  I always get the boneless wings, but my friends have raved about the other bar foods; nachos, quesadillas, etc.  

The service here is friendly, and there's a variety of different feels as well.  You can hang out at the bar or go to their restaurant.  You can also wander off into the casino and play.  There's also another section I haven't been to.  I understand they have karaoke there.. I'm not sure if it's another bar or another restaurant. Come to think of it; I don't know what Ellis Island is.  I initially thought of it as a bar, but truth be told; it offers about as much as most casinos do, just on a smaller scale.  I think it's open 24 hours too!

This is a must stop every Vegas trip.  The BBQ ribs are to good to pass up.  For the price, you just can't beat it.  Either share a plate or prepare to have leftovers.  Service is friendly and fast.  The restaurant is 21 and older. No kids

Ate here last night on a thurs 530 or so. Excellent BBQ place. Very casual. A little off the strip near koval and flamingo. Best ribs and chicken around. Super great sauce and sides come with it.The price you can't beat. Simple menu and food came super quick and service was fabulous. Will be back there soon and I am a local and usually try to avoid the strip but worth driving to this place. It is in their small casino and I did read that no one under 21 is permitted so important to know if you plan to bring kids.

Ribs are so damn good. This place is a gem.  A can't miss. Chicken is good but just not as good as the ribs. The sides are ok. 

Service is lightning quick.  They apparently smoke the ribs and chicken from early in the morning.  I got mine about 5 minutes after I ordered. 

Beer here is brewed in premises and cheap.  2.75 in the restaurant and 2.50 at the bar.  There are about 6 different beers they brew.  Quality is ok.  Not great but definitely drinkable.

First of all, their ribs are gooood.

The thing made me mad was the service. We went on 5pm Tusday so there was no line in front, got a table quickly and assumed the waiter wasn't too busy to take care of us. I didn't get the name of the waiter, a bald guy, was certainly not in a good mood that day. We ordered the food quickly and soon the food came, but together with a to-go box that wasn't ask for. At that moment, I could foresee that my glass was never getting filled again, and could be a long wait for the check, and I was right. No refill on the water, the waiter never came back again, had to catch him to ask for the check at the end. Waited half an hour for the check.
Super good food! Also, large portions. Great place to enjoy bbq. The service was fairly quick and the ambience of the restaurant is nice.

Not too customer friendly. If you are not a guest of the hotel you can't order BBQ to go. You gave to eat within the BBQ dining area. You can't even take it to the bar area. And from 6:30 - 8 there is no food service in the bar area except for appetizers. What kind of weird service is this?!

OMG!
They don't have a big menu but what they do have to offer is some of the best in Vegas.  The food, service and pricing is perfect. 

Ricardo was our server and he was awesome.  We got 2 platters.  Each had a  1/2 chicken,  1/2 rack of ribs, slaw, corn and great bread.  We really enjoyed it and we will be back for more.

Numerous people we met in our resort recommended this place.  We even had printed info from the resort that noted it was a great place to eat and not cost much.   We were there on a Friday night about 8 PM.   We were told before they seated us that they didn't have whole slabs of ribs.   Nice way to entice us to eat there.   We sat for quite a while before anyone even came to get our drink orders.  We opted for the half rack/ half chicken.  Please know there isn't many options here.   Ribs or chicken.  No choice of sides...they all come with the same sides:  baked beans, slaw, 2 half ears of frozen soggy, flavorless corn on the cob and some so called garlic bread.  I will say that the price is right so you do get what you pay for.  The ribs were just OK.  Hubby's chicken was nearly black on the outside, which I don't mind but he didn't like.   Service was not great.  Would we go back?  Nope!

I was told about this restaurant 3 years ago and last night I finally tried it. It was worth the trip. The ribs are pretty good. It's inside a casino in the back, all they serve are ribs and chicken.

The place itself looks a bit seedy, so you know it's good! There are no reservations, so you might have to wait to get in but have a beer at the seedy karaoke bar and relax until your turn.

Prices are good too, full slab of ribs about $11. What a win win.

I'll definitely go back

So we are in Las Vegas for spring break and we went to the stratosphere for dinner and it was amazing and then we went to Gordon Ramsay's Hell Kitchen for lunch and it was absolutely horrible so tonight we tried Ellis Island for dinner and it was absolutely delicious we had the steak dinner special and our daughter had the fried chicken and then we had the dessert brownie thing this place gets 5 stars from us great service fast service and delicious food

Best value in Las Vegas for more than 10 years going.... Marco is the greatest waiter in Vegas. 

Make sure you try the root beer.   It's amazing all the way around and well worth the wait if there is any.

It's a combined 5 stars between value and quality. We were told about this place by a local and he did us right. His tip was to get a free players club card that gives you discounts on the BBQ dinner. All you have to do is play at least $5 worth with the card. With the discounts our dinners came out to $14. 

Now about the food and service. The service could definitely be better. When we checked in, the hostess acted like she was doing us a favor by putting us on the wait list with an attitude to boot. 

It's not a very big restaurant so it doesn't hold a lot of people, yet the wait help wasn't very good. I feel that a waiter / waitress should check up on their tables every once in a while. That's not asking too much. 

The food is where it's at. Well mainly the bbq that is. The corn is the frozen kind, I've had better beans from a can, the cole slaw had too much onion, the bread was, well bread. Nothing special about their side dishes. 

The ribs and chicken, which is all they have on the menu, is very good. Not having eaten at a lot of bbq restaurants, it's the best restaurant ribs I've had. The chicken is good but not as good as the ribs. Overall it's a killer deal in an expensive town. You get a lot of food. More than the average person can eat in a single sitting. 

Since you're already in Vegas, why not give this place a try.

Think I found a greasy
Spoon truck stop in the back of a small casino. Service was good, not great. Some food was great, the chicken fried chicken with white gravy. The sides were
Less than editable. ( the garlic green beans, dried and no taste.

Ok had to try the famous rib place in Ellis island. Only from 4pm to 10pm it was packed but they text you when your table is ready. 

Now the food was good it came with corn, coleslaw, baked beans and garlic bread. I ordered the full rack of ribs. It came sauced and pretty tender. There was sauce on the table but it tasted like bulls eye. The service was ok, it was very busy so that didn't help. Overall the value is good but have to deal with noisy atmosphere, and all the smoking since it's a small casino with low ceiling. The clientele isn't all that great either. Definitely a grub place not a date place. Wouldn't take kids here that's for sure. 

Now you have to get a players card and a coupon from a kiosk that will get you like $3 off the regular price. A full rack of baby backs with coupon is $14.99 without $17.99

They also have half rack of baby backs  or half chicken or half and half.

P.S. get a glass of root beer thats house made not too sweet and too carbonated, Ellis island is also one of the best micro brewery in las vegas so if your a beer drinker might want to try their different beers. The price is cheap also for a glass like $3.50 for a tall glass
Super friendly staff and super affordable huge meals. We had breakfast there, try steak and eggs! The place is a bit off the Strip, but totally worth it.

What happened???? This place used to be great. They have revamped the restaurant but the food is gone downhill. Apparently it's more of a microbrewery now. I had fettuccine no garlic very bland had to add salt and pepper to it to give it any flavor. The slice of bread was just that, A slice of bread no garlic no spices nothing. Wait person never asked if we wanted to drink. Won't be back.
For BBQ, it's AMAZING. delicious delicious bbq. The full rack of ribs is too much, delicious but boy you walk away stuffed. These ribs are awesome, and I loved this restaurant.

Awesome place to eat! We went with a group of friends, and we all loved our food! Great ribs and chicken, sauce is amazing, and gluten free. Portions sizes are large and served with corn, coleslaw etc.. highly recommend! Very reasonably priced, one of the few places anymore where you get large portions and great food, reasonably price, and you will leave stuffed!

Not going to lie, sometimes the food can be a little hit or miss. For instance, I always order the half chicken and half ribs and I've gotten plates where the chicken was incredibly moist and perfect while the ribs were dry...and also vice versa. But for the most party, the food here is BOMB!!!! I'm not a huge beans person, but man oh man, do I love their baked beans. The cole slaw isn't anything to rave about, but it does provide a nice little refresher to get all the bbq coating out of your mouth. I really wished the had mac n cheese or mashed potatoes...I never touch the corn and normally only take a bite out of the bread they give you. I think I'll ask them to omit the corn and bread next time because I feel bad for wasting it. The service is fairly good, though there is one host that can be a little rude (not sure if it's just a language barrier that makes her seem rude)...on 2 different nights, before we could even say anything, when we walked up, she immediately barked "ID?!" My husband and I were both stunned, and thought...'that's a first...never thought I'd be ID'd trying to eat ribs' and after we asked for a table for just the two of us, she grabbed menus and started to walk to a booth. We started to follow her and she turns around and, again, barks at us to "wait there! i have to prepare the table first" and lastly, on one of the nights, we were already ready to order (having eaten there 2 nights in a row) and let her know that we were ready to order if she could get our server and she says "i'm not your server" and walks away. That one host aside, Ellis Island is still one of our favorite places to grab dinner...and it's cheap!

In town with another couple. First night in town asked hotel for the best place to eat near by. They sent us to Ellis Island Bbq. Really good food at a really good price. The menu is small only 4 choses to choose from. Each of us ordered a different item and was all surprised on how good the food was. The only complaint was the chicken was a little on the dry side. They also brew there own beer and the Amber ale was great

Just SO good!!!! I don't even eat that much, and I just had to. The half chicken and half rack are amazing and their assortment of beers were very good. Priced fairly whether you get a players card or not. Must try if you're a bbq fan!

I love this place for ribs!  Only 2 things on the menu Chicken and ribs!  No choices of sides - you get corn, beans, slaw and bread.  $15.99 if you walk over and get a players card.  But wait it gets better! Did I say they brew their own beer.  $2.75....yes that's right $2.75 for a tall draft.  The beer is excellent.  The ribs are excellent - meaty, Smokey, and tender.  You have to stop here!!!!!!

Great affordable food and drinks, which is tough to come by close to the strip. Highly recommend. Service is typically a little slow, only complaint. But I keep coming back so obviously not a deal breaker!
Been here 3 tumes already! Love the ribs, love the place only one problem is can't bring anyone in if they aren't 21 but other than that, will come back for the slab of ribs!
Really awesome bbq ribs and chicken for a damn fair price. I only wish they had a few more items on their menu. Full bar.

This BBQ is good! So delicious in fact that people line up early! It has been consistently good over the years, which is great, especially for those who don't get to visit Vegas often, because when you come back, it's just how you remembered it. 

I hadn't been to Ellis Island BBQ in years and when we came, they had completely remodeled the area. The old BBQ restaurant sat to the side of the pizza kiosk and booths were all out in the open, close to foot traffic, those staring at you longingly to hurry the fuck up so they could eat (those were true expressions on their faces), and those who were playing machines, not even 3 feet from your table, if you happen to get a booth on the outside of the aisle. You also had the option of eating outside, but you were at the mercy of the elements...sometimes it would be cold as hell out there, but you'd take the first available table, anyway because of the long wait. It was also really cool to eat outside, because you got to walk through the brewery to the outside patio. Ellis Island makes their own beer and rootbeer, so it's even more special to go there and be able to try their many selections.

Anyway, the new BBQ restaurant is really nice. You're able to sit away from all the noise and smoke and it seems to run more efficiently. The restaurant is in one of the corners of the casino and there are many more booths and tables. There's a hostess who will greet you and either seat you right away or let you know how long the wait is. Sometimes those waits can be epic, so try to get there as soon as they open...even more so because if they run out of food, they close. It doesn't take long to order because their menu is very simple. They have 3 plates to choose from: A full rack, a half rack, and a half rack and half chicken. All come with beans, coleslaw, garlic bread, and corn on the cob. Plates generally come out within 5 minutes of ordering and that helps with the flow of things. 

Once voted the best BBQ in Vegas several years in a row, I see why. The flavor is so rich and you can taste the smokey tones in the meat. That sauce...oh man, that sauce! Nice, thick, and hearty! They leave a nice big  squeeze bottle of it on your table in case you want extra. It's definitely worth a trip when you come to Vegas.

Was told the wait was 25 min. An hour later.... we sit.... we order.... we eat...
If it takes longer to get in, than it does to eat messy BBQ. .. rethink it. 
The only reason I am giving 2 stars is that the ribs were semi decent.

Food: 9/10
Service: 8/10
Value: 8/10
Ambience: 7/10

TL;DR - I'm not going to bother searching for another BBQ joint in Vegas because I have no doubt this place has the best BBQ ribs I've ever tasted (trust me, I'm half-Texan)

21 and older only. They will text you when your table is ready. Get yourself a play card while waiting for minor savings.

The place was dimmed and cozy. There was no cigarette smell, and the waiter was attentive and friendly enough...kind of.

The menu was short and simple. Both chicken and ribs were tender and the sauce was out of this world. Normally I'd opt for a spicy version, but their sweet BBQ sauce almost converted me. All the sides were good and the portion was enormous and worth every penny.

I finished everyone else's leftover 3 days later in a hotel room back in LA, and they were still delicious (This was after sitting in the fridge for over 2 days, thawed in the trunk of our car for 4 hours driving back to LA, then back into the fridge again for a couple hours before I nuked it in the microwave in hotel lobby for 3 minutes and ate with some cold parts still).

Full disclosure: I was salivating like crazy while typing this review.
Great food, the ribs are the best. Goes great with a stout beer which Ellis Island brews themselves. Will definitely return again when in town.

Great inexpensive breakfast in Vegas!  It is off of the beaten path but a nice walk.  Try the ham and eggs or steak and eggs.  We shared one breakfast and had more than enough!  This place is not fancy...but everything was delicious.

I try to come here whenever I'm in town. I've been here a couple of times & it has not let me down!

Let's start with how the portions are HUGE! I usually get the 1/2 rack of ribs & 1/2 chicken & I never finish it in one sitting.. not even half!! Served with garlic toast, coleslaw, corn, & beans. 
The ribs are good & the chicken isn't dry at all! & for the small price of this meal, you sure won't regret giving this play a try!

But remember, it's 21+ only!

If you like BBQ you must go. Everything is delicious. Usually I'm not a BBQ person but I would go out of my way to eat here. I had half a BBQ chicken which was so juicy and tender it just melted in your mouth and the sauce was sooo good. They have ribs and chicken or combo of both served with coleslaw, bbq beans, corn on cob and garlic bread. You must go if you haven't been. There is a wait to eat but well worth the wait.

Hands down the best BBQ in Vegas. And I've been to most all of them. Ellis is the only place I keep coming back to. The quality is 5 stars. The portions are 5 stars. The service is always 5 stars. You've won my heart Ellis Island time and time again...

You can't beat the deals here. You will NOT find better ribs anywhere for miles.

See Ricardo, he's the best server with a smile.

My husband and I went based on reviews. Best place in Vegas!!! We were excited that Ellis Island had free parking and a brewery!! - in addition to the casino. 

We arrived pretty late - about 1 hour before closing. Because of this, we were asked to please wait so that they could be sure they had enough food for the last party they sat - based on that they would/wouldn't be able to take us. 

Lucky for us, they had 2 racks of ribs left - so we ordered that!! Hands - down the best BBQ. Absolutely ah-mazing and an excellent price!! 

I am not a big BBQ fan - but my husband is. Despite this we would frequent Ellis Island if we were locals and will be going every time we are in Vegas from now on!! 

Did I mention the excellent beer? - my husband had the Hefe and I had the Light - both super good and a big cold glass for $2.50! - unheard-of in Vegas!!! 

If you like BBQ and Beer. Don't bother going anywhere else!
Where can you get the simplest of barbecue menu's, chicken or ribs and corn, slaw, bread, and beans all for less than $15 if you have the players card. It's worth it.

It might become my favorite place to eat in Vegas! The casino doesn't look very inviting but the bbq restaurant is absolutely fantastic. The portions are huge. We got a chicken barbecue and a 1/2 rack of ribs. The meat was melting in my mouth. The service is very fast, and the place is always crowded. The prices are fair for what you get.

This place really hits the spot for BBQ lovers! Great prices with tie-in promos to lower it even more, I had the half chicken and half rack of ribs and loved every bite. The coleslaw and beans were delicious as well as the garlic bread. The only thing that I felt could have been better was the corn. It was a little mushier than I would have preferred. I was impressed with their microbrew beers too! Will definitely come back on a return visit to Vegas.

Wow the bbq was soooo tasty!!! It was definitely worth every penny. I got the steak garlic green bean and loaded potato dish and it did not disappoint. Check this place out when you are in Vegas if you love BBQ.
